summaryText: Wow, what a powerful sermon about the heartbeat of Impact Church! Pastor Travis Hearn takes us on a deeply personal journey, sharing how his own life transformation on February 20th, 1993, after being arrested for DUI, became the catalyst for understanding the true mission of the church. PT reveals that Impact Church is fundamentally about two core principles: the Great Commandment and the Great Commission. He passionately explains that their purpose is simple yet profound - to love God with everything and love your neighbor as yourself, and then to go and make disciples. It's not about filling church seats, but about transforming lives! Can you imagine a church that's more concerned with genuine discipleship than just Sunday attendance? Pastor Travis challenges us to be more than consumers of Christianity, but active participants in spreading Jesus' message. His personal testimony is a powerful reminder that one encounter with God can completely revolutionize your life's direction. The most striking moment is when he shares how a single night in jail led him to Jesus, proving that God can use any circumstance to draw us closer to Him.
mainPoints: Impact Church is a Great Commandment Church
Impact Church is a Great Commission Church
We are called to be disciples who make disciples

versesMentioned.text: Jesus said to him, 'I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.'
For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God.

Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, and teaching them to obey everything I have commanded you. And surely I am with you always, to the very end of the age.

Jesus replied: 'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.' This is the first and greatest commandment. And the second is like it: 'Love your neighbor as yourself.'
So that you may become blameless and pure, 'children of God without fault in a warped and crooked generation.' Then you will shine among them like stars in the sky.
But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.
But if I say, 'I will not mention his word or speak anymore in his name,' his word is in my heart like a fire, a fire shut up in my bones. I am weary of holding it in; indeed, I cannot.

Monday.scripture: Matthew 28:19: 'Therefore go and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.'
Monday.focus: Understanding my personal calling to disciple others
Monday.action: Identify one person in your life who needs spiritual guidance. Pray for an opportunity to share your faith with them this week.
Monday.prayer: Lord, give me courage and wisdom to share Your love with others. Help me be a vessel of Your grace and truth. Open doors for meaningful spiritual conversations. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 1 Peter 3:15: 'But in your hearts revere Christ as Lord. Always be prepared to give an answer to everyone who asks you to give the reason for the hope that you have.'
Tuesday.focus: Preparing to share my personal testimony
Tuesday.action: Write out your personal story of faith. Practice articulating how Jesus has transformed your life in a clear, concise manner.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me understand my own story of redemption. Give me clarity and confidence to share how You've worked in my life. Make me bold yet humble. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Philippians 2:13: 'For it is God who works in you to will and to act in order to fulfill his good purpose.'
Wednesday.focus: Recognizing God's ongoing work in my life
Wednesday.action: Reflect on areas where God is currently challenging and growing you. Journal about these transformative processes.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, reveal the areas of my life where You are working. Help me surrender to Your process of sanctification. Make me moldable and responsive to Your Spirit. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Matthew 5:16: 'In the same way, let your light shine before others, that they may see your good deeds and glorify your Father in heaven.'
Thursday.action: Intentionally perform an act of kindness for someone who doesn't know you're a Christian. Let your actions speak of God's love.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me shine Your light today. Let my actions and attitude reflect Your love and grace. Use me as an instrument of Your peace. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 10:14: 'How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them?'
Friday.focus: Understanding the importance of sharing the Gospel
Friday.action: Research and learn about effective evangelism techniques. Consider taking a course or reading a book about sharing your faith.
Friday.prayer: God, give me a heart for the lost. Overcome my fears and hesitations about sharing Your good news. Make me bold and compassionate. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Acts 1:8: 'But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth.'
Saturday.focus: Embracing my role as a disciple
Saturday.action: Spend time in prayer, asking God to reveal your unique calling and how you can make disciples in your immediate sphere of influence.
Saturday.prayer: Holy Spirit, guide me and empower me. Show me the specific ways You want to use me to build Your kingdom. Make me available and willing. Amen.
